meanings.definition: The behavior of defending a territory against intruders.
meanings.sent1: The territorialisms of the dog were evident as it barked at anyone approaching its yard.
meanings.sent2: The territorialisms of the lion were on display as it roared to warn others to stay away.
meanings.sent3: The territorialisms of the cat were comical as it puffed up its fur to look bigger than it was.
meanings.sent4: The territorialisms of the squirrel were like a fortress protecting its acorns from thieves.
meanings.sent5: The territorialisms of the bird were so strong that even other birds dared not enter its tree.

meanings.definition: Expressions or behaviors that are characteristic of a particular region or group.
meanings.sent1: The territorialisms of the locals included unique greetings and customs.
meanings.sent2: The territorialisms of the tribe were evident in their traditional dances and songs.
meanings.sent3: The territorialisms of the family were endearing, like their secret recipes passed down for generations.
meanings.sent4: The territorialisms of the team created a bond stronger than any competition.
meanings.sent5: The territorialisms of the community made it feel like a close-knit family.
